docs.snippet: Observing Jewish dietary laws is a particular challenge in the modern world, partly because they govern not just food but also the appliances used for cooking. For example, in a kosher household a blender must have two jars and two blades, to keep...
docs.abstract: Lise Stern writes How to Keep Kosher; photo (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: Observing Jewish dietary laws is a particular challenge in the modern world, partly because they govern not just food but also the appliances used for cooking. For example, in a kosher household a blender must have two jars and two blades, to keep meat and dairy separate. Lisë Stern advises cooks on contemporary ways of adhering to these ancient laws, called kashrut, in ''How to Keep Kosher'' (William Morrow, $24.95). She discusses how to gradually establish a kosher kitchen, talks about special holiday requirements and explains subtle distinctions in the rules for handling meat, fish and poultry. There is a small collection of traditional recipes, for dishes like matzoh balls and cholent.

docs.snippet: Having honed his Provençal palate as the executive chef at NICE MATIN  on the Upper West Side, ANDY D'AMICO , below, has added another city in the south of France to his portfolio. He is now also the executive chef at MARSEILLE , 630 Ninth Avenue...
docs.abstract: Andy D'Amico becomes executive chef at Marseille, Ninth Avenue and 44th Street; photo; Alex Urena takes over kitchen duties at Suba (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: Having honed his Provençal palate as the executive chef at NICE MATIN on the Upper West Side, ANDY D'AMICO , below, has added another city in the south of France to his portfolio. He is now also the executive chef at MARSEILLE , 630 Ninth Avenue (44th Street), where his menu includes tapenade, sardines, daube of beef and rouget fillets with ratatouille. ALEX UREÑA , who was the chef at Marseille, has taken over the kitchen duties at SUBA , 109 Ludlow Street (Delancey Street), where he is looking to Spain with dishes like Galician octopus, cauliflower gazpacho, salmon a la plancha and paella.

docs.snippet: What goes on as a restaurant gears up to the dinner hour? What is the staff told about specials or the wines that go with them? You can find out for yourself at Beacon, 25 West 56th Street, where the staff meal is open to the public on Thursdays f...
docs.lead_paragraph: What goes on as a restaurant gears up to the dinner hour? What is the staff told about specials or the wines that go with them? You can find out for yourself at Beacon, 25 West 56th Street, where the staff meal is open to the public on Thursdays from 4:45 to 6 p.m. Unlike most staff meals, which are stand-up affairs in the kitchen, this one is served buffet style in the dining room near the wood ovens.

headline.main: Dinner and Dessert With a Waiter's-Eye View

docs.snippet: Making ice cream at home once required lots of ice and rock salt. Then came hand-churners with canisters that had to be frozen overnight. Electric models with automatic churning replaced those. Now, the most convenient ice-cream makers have intern...
docs.abstract: Cuisinart's new ice cream machine makes more than quart of ice cream in less than one hour; photo (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: Making ice cream at home once required lots of ice and rock salt. Then came hand-churners with canisters that had to be frozen overnight. Electric models with automatic churning replaced those. Now, the most convenient ice-cream makers have internal compressors to do the chilling, with no need to freeze a canister. Most of these have been imported from Italy, with prices hovering near $1,000. But Cuisinart's new model is $250 at Williams-Sonoma. It makes a quart and a half of ice cream or sorbet in less than an hour. It is easy to use and easy to clean, but the machine -- about the size of a toaster oven -- is noisy. I found the recipes in the accompanying booklet a tad too sweet.

headline.main: An Ice Cream Maker for Those Small of Freezer or Wallet

docs.snippet: PARK AVENUE CAFE , the culinary flagship of the Smith & Wollensky Restaurant Group, has been given a less countrified look with bright red accents. And in place of a wine list, two tables have been set up, one with bottles of red wines and the oth...
docs.abstract: Park Avenue Cafe, culinary flagship of Smith & Wolensky Restaurant Group, is given a less countrified look, with bright red accents; Neil Murphy is new executive chef; photo (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: PARK AVENUE CAFE , the culinary flagship of the Smith & Wollensky Restaurant Group, has been given a less countrified look with bright red accents. And in place of a wine list, two tables have been set up, one with bottles of red wines and the other with whites, each labeled with its price. The restaurant, on the southeast corner of 63rd Street, was for years the showcase for the cooking of David Burke, but it now has a new executive chef, NEIL MURPHY , below. He was the chef de cuisine for six years. GINO and FERNANDO MASCI , the owners of IL MULINO in Greenwich Village, plan to offer their heaping antipasto platters at a 110-seat branch of their restaurant, to open next month on Northern Boulevard in Roslyn Heights on Long Island.

docs.snippet: On Eighth Avenue near Times Square, a part of the city where subway has more than one meaning, Eban Ross, left, hopes to improve the sandwich options. Mr. Ross, a chef who worked with Michel Richard at Citrus in Los Angeles, has opened Carve, 760 ...
docs.abstract: Eban Ross opens Carve, sandwich shop on Eighth Avenue and 47th Street; photo (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: On Eighth Avenue near Times Square, a part of the city where subway has more than one meaning, Eban Ross, left, hopes to improve the sandwich options. Mr. Ross, a chef who worked with Michel Richard at Citrus in Los Angeles, has opened Carve, 760 Eighth Avenue (47th Street), a gleaming baby-blue-and-white spot. Fine ingredients like applewood smoked bacon, turkey cooked on a rotisserie and fresh tuna crusted with ginger and sesame are piled on fresh breads, or, for those counting carbs, wrapped in lettuce. Sandwiches are $5 to $9; soups, salads and breakfast items are also available.

headline.main: Sandwiches, With or Without the Bread

docs.snippet: To keep your golf game in top form, you can now practice putting on a 14-foot swath of artificial turf at Grand Central Terminal during a lunch break or at cocktail time. It has been set up at the outdoor cafe for Michael Jordan's: The Steak House...
docs.abstract: Michael Jordan's outdoor cafe in Midtown Manhattan offers putting green for patrons; photo (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: To keep your golf game in top form, you can now practice putting on a 14-foot swath of artificial turf at Grand Central Terminal during a lunch break or at cocktail time. It has been set up at the outdoor cafe for Michael Jordan's: The Steak House N.Y.C., protected under the arches along Vanderbilt Avenue at 43rd Street. Anytime while having lunch or drinks, duffers can pick up a putter, or enter a putting contest for prizes.

docs.snippet: KATY SPARKS is now in charge of the kitchen at COMPASS, 208 West 70th Street. Ms. Sparks, left, who was the chef at Quilty's in SoHo, which closed, had been trying to open her own restaurant. ''The deals kept falling through, and I just wanted to ...
docs.abstract: Katy Sparks is now in charge of kitchen at Compass; photo; Thomas Keller says he wants to reopen Per Se, in Time Warner Center, by April 1; restaurant was damaged by fire on Feb 21 (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: KATY SPARKS is now in charge of the kitchen at COMPASS, 208 West 70th Street. Ms. Sparks, left, who was the chef at Quilty's in SoHo, which closed, had been trying to open her own restaurant. ''The deals kept falling through, and I just wanted to be cooking again,'' she said. She described her new menu at Compass as global, with some Germanic touches like spaetzle, horseradish and pumpkinseed oil. She replaces Mark Andelbradt. The front room of the restaurant is to become a wine bar. ''We're hoping to reopen by April 1,'' THOMAS KELLER said of PER SE, his restaurant in the Time Warner Center, which was open just six days when it was damaged by a fire on Feb. 21. Smoke and water damaged walls and the wine cellar, but his $85,000 Bonnet stove survived, he said. Reservations are not yet being taken.

docs.snippet: Water buffaloes have always been considered the source of the finest mozzarella. But the only way to get it was to import it from Italy. Last spring, at his Star Hill Dairy in Woodstock, Vt., David Muller began milking a small herd of water buffal...
docs.abstract: Star Hill Dairy in Woodstock, Vt, is producing buffalo mozzarella; photo (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: Water buffaloes have always been considered the source of the finest mozzarella. But the only way to get it was to import it from Italy. Last spring, at his Star Hill Dairy in Woodstock, Vt., David Muller began milking a small herd of water buffaloes to make yogurt. That turned out to be a delicious tease, because now he is also producing the only buffalo mozzarella made in the United States. Star Hill Dairy's is certainly fresher than any Italian import. A small snowy globe, a mere four ounces, is satiny and just firm enough on the outside to hold its sumptuously creamy heart. Without the ripe summer tomatoes and basil it deserves, consider serving it with a drizzle of fruity olive oil and some lightly sautéed mushrooms or slices of roasted beets.

docs.snippet: I was impressed with Imoya, a South African brandy, when I first tasted it at a safari camp in Botswana. You can find it now in New York, in a dark green frosted bottle with a stopper that suggests an African headdress. Imoya is made in Cognac-sty...
docs.abstract: Imoya, South African brandy, is now available in New York; photo (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: I was impressed with Imoya, a South African brandy, when I first tasted it at a safari camp in Botswana. You can find it now in New York, in a dark green frosted bottle with a stopper that suggests an African headdress. Imoya is made in Cognac-style copper pot stills by KWV International, one of the largest wine producers in the wine country near Cape Town. The brandy is plush, full-bodied and assertive, with a nut-sweet aroma and a spicy richness. Imoya is about $30 for a 750 milliliter bottle and is also available in a gift package with two brandy snifters for about $32 at Chelsea Wines, 200 West 21st Street; Spring Street Wine Shop, 187 Spring Street (Thompson Street); and PJ Wine, 4898 Broadway (204th Street).
